description: Illinois Governor JB Pritzker on Wednesday said his administration is preparing for potential budget hits from the incoming Trump administration, following a similar warning from California’s Gavin Newsom earlier this week.
title: Pritzker Says Illinois Is ‘On Guard’ for Any Trump Hit to Budget

description: Chad averted a “destabilization attempt” after unknown assailants opened gunfire near the presidential palace in the capital, N’djamena.
title: Chad Army Foils Attack as Gunfire Erupts Near Presidency

description: Malaysia’s growth is set to sustain last year’s pace and exceed 5% in 2025, as strong foreign direct investments and support from local funds shield the economy from any global risks, Second Finance Minister Amir Hamzah Azizan said.
title: Malaysia’s Growth Set to Surpass 5% This Year, Minister Says

description: Keir Starmer plans to set up a sanctions regime targeting people smugglers as the UK prime minister seeks to deliver on an electoral pledge to “smash the gangs” helping asylum seekers enter the country via irregular routes.
title: UK to Target People Smugglers With Sanctions to Stem Migration

description: The Biden administration is racing to put out an executive order meant to shore up US cybersecurity in its dwindling days in office, according to four people familiar with the matter.
title: White House Rushes to Finish Cyber Order After China Hacks

description: Even as Russia seems to have the upper hand in its invasion of Ukraine, the Kremlin faces a growing number of challenges that will complicate any effort to lock in its gains, the outgoing Pentagon chief said.
title: Russia Doesn’t Hold All the Cards in Ukraine, Pentagon’s Austin Says

description: President Joe Biden’s administration plans one additional round of restrictions on the export of artificial intelligence chips from the likes of Nvidia Corp. just days before leaving office, a final push in his effort to keep advanced technologies out of the hands of China and Russia.
title: Biden to Further Limit Nvidia, AMD AI Chip Exports in Final Push

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, deputy congressional editor Mike Dorning breaks down how Republicans are approaching Donald Trump’s agenda. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Republicans’ Strategy for Acting on Trump Priorities ‘Clear as Mud’

description: Canada’s ruling Liberal Party is reviewing how it picks its next leader, set to be the next prime minister, after Justin Trudeau announced Monday he plans to resign.
title: Easy Entry in Vote to Replace Trudeau Sparks Meddling Fears

description: The billions of dollars in spending that an unprecedented lifting of visa requirements could have brought simply hasn’t materialized.
title: China’s Biggest-Ever Bid for Foreign Tourists Is Falling Flat

description: Daniel Lurie, an heir to the Levi Strauss fortune, took office as San Francisco’s new mayor on Wednesday with a vow to upend the status quo in a city struggling to revive itself as a thriving tech and financial hub.
title: San Francisco’s Wealthy New Mayor Takes Office With Vow to Fix City

description: Donald Trump’s claim that the US doesn’t need anything from Canada is “simply false,” said Jonathan Wilkinson, Canada’s energy minister and a potential candidate in the contest to replace Justin Trudeau as prime minister.
title: Canada Energy Minister Warns Trump Against an Oil Trade War

description: Poland’s finance chief opted to delay the release of disputed state funds to the former ruling nationalist party, risking further political turmoil ahead of the country’s presidential election.
title: Poland Drags Heels on Releasing Funds to Former Ruling Party

description: US President-elect Donald Trump’s escalating threats about tariffs and his rhetoric about annexing Canada have prompted some Canadian business leaders to call for an immediate election campaign.
title: Canadian CEOs Push for Early Election as Trump Escalates His Threats

description: Poland’s president asked the government to shield Benjamin Netanyahu from potential arrest if the Israeli prime minister attends a commemoration in the country of the 80th anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz.
title: Polish President Seeks Protection for Netanyahu at Auschwitz Liberation Event

description: The UK’s opposition Conservative Party tried and failed to force Prime Minister Keir Starmer into holding a national inquiry into a scandal surrounding so-called child grooming gangs.
title: UK Tories Fail in Bid to Force Starmer to Hold Rape Gang Probe

description: An Islamist militia with links to the Islamic State killed more than 650 civilians in Democratic Republic of Congo between June and early November, one of the deadliest campaigns by the group on record, United Nations experts said Wednesday.
title: Islamist Rebels on Record Killing Spree in Congo, UN Experts Say

description: Despite bellicose language from President-elect Donald Trump, a US takeover of Greenland will never occur, Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Wednesday in Paris.
title: Blinken Rejects a Trump Greenland Grab as ‘Not Going to Happen’

description: M23 rebels appear to be planning a long-term occupation of mineral-rich territories in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, United Nations experts warned in a report released Wednesday.
title: Rebels Plan to Occupy Mineral-Rich Congo Region, UN Experts Warn

description: President Joe Biden’s administration is preparing to announce Wednesday the final $500 million dollars in US military assistance it will provide to Ukraine, according to people familiar with the plans.
title: Biden to Announce Final $500 Million in Ukraine Military Aid

description: Bank of France Governor Francois Villeroy de Galhau said the government must be as ambitious as possible with budget cuts to tackle the “chronic sickness” of the country’s public finances and restore economic confidence after months of political upheaval.
title: France’s Villeroy Urges Big Budget Cuts to Cure Fiscal Sickness

description: Romania will hold a repeat of last year’s contested presidential election on May 4, months after the country’s top court annulled the ballot over allegations of Russian meddling.
title: Romania to Hold Rescheduled Presidential Election in May

description: Benin is moving fast to secure fresh external financing and may launch the first Eurobond from Africa in 2025.
title: Benin Sets the Stage for Africa’s First Eurobond Issue of 2025

description: The race to be Canada’s next prime minister is still at the starting line and Donald Trump has already cast a shadow over it.
title: Trump Threats Shape Canada’s Succession Race Before It Has Really Begun

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s advisers are considering how they will reshape the leadership of the Federal Reserve including elevating Fed Governor Michelle Bowman to be the central bank’s next vice chair for supervision, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump Advisers Look to Reshape Fed Leadership as Roles Open

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said at least 13 people were killed in a Russian strike against the southern city of Zaporizhizhia.
title: Zelenskiy Says Russian Strike Kills 13 in Southern Ukraine

description: Mexico’s president responded in kind to Donald Trump’s latest jibes, suggesting part of the US be renamed instead of the Gulf of Mexico.
title: Mexico’s President Jabs Back at Trump in Territorial Naming Spat

description: A faction of President-elect Donald Trump’s allies is harboring doubts about Republicans’ chances of passing a sweeping tax bill in 2025 amid party infighting and strategy disputes.
title: Trump Allies Fret Tax-Cut Pledges at Risk With GOP Infighting

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz pushed back on comments made by US President-elect Donald Trump, including a threat to use economic force to annex Canada and to seize Greenland.
title: Scholz Calls on the US to Respect the Inviolability of Borders

description: The top US nuclear regulator is on a mission to streamline approvals for new reactors and accelerate power-plant construction.
title: US Nuclear Regulator Pursues ‘More Efficient’ Reactor Approvals

description: Canadian Finance Minister Dominic LeBlanc has decided not to run for leadership of the Liberal Party, saying he needs to focus on countering the threat of tariffs from Donald Trump’s administration.
title: Canada Finance Minister LeBlanc Says He Won’t Run for Liberal Leader

description: Colombia’s leader said he will skip Nicolás Maduro’s presidential inauguration this week due to rising repression and the arrests of Venezuelan political leaders.
title: Petro to Skip Maduro Inauguration Over Venezuela Political Prisoners

description: The US Department of Justice asked a federal appeals court to deny an effort by President-elect Donald Trump and his associates to stop the public release of Special Counsel Jack Smith’s final report.
title: DOJ Asks Court to Let Trump Special Counsel Report Be Public

description: US Representative Mike Lawler slammed his home state of New York for high spending and said he will push President-elect Donald Trump to raise the cap on state and local tax deductions hurting many of the state’s taxpayers.
title: New York’s Lawler Says Higher SALT Cap ‘Critical’ for Taxpayers

description: Lebanese lawmakers will attempt to elect a first president in more than two years this week, with army commander Joseph Aoun one of the two main candidates to lead a country battered by months of war.
title: Lebanon Seeks to Elect First President Since 2022 in Wake of War

description: Poland will hold its presidential election on May 18, kicking off a contest for a key role that the ruling alliance hopes to pry away from the nationalist opposition.
title: Poland to Hold Presidential Election on May 18

description: Venezuela’s government has unleashed a fresh wave of repression as the opposition plans nationwide protests to denounce Nicolás Maduro’s inauguration as president this week.
title: Maduro Ratchets Up Repression Ahead of Inauguration in Venezuela

description: Friedrich Merz, the German conservative who is the front-runner to become the next chancellor, downplayed a remark by US President-elect Donald Trump calling for NATO members to more than double defense spending.
title: Germany’s Chancellor Front-Runner Downplays Trump NATO Demand

description: President-elect Donald Trump asked the US Supreme Court to intervene in his hush money criminal case to prevent his Jan. 10 sentencing from going forward.
title: Trump Asks Supreme Court to Halt His Hush Money Sentencing

description: Meta Platforms Inc. offered to publish listings from classified ads rival eBay Inc. on Facebook Marketplace in an effort to comply with a landmark European Union antitrust order that was accompanied by a €798 million ($822 million) fine.
title: Meta Floats EBay Ads Fix to Comply With EU Antitrust Order

description: The UK is considering front-loading its funding package for Mauritius as part of a sweetened deal ceding sovereignty of the Chagos islands, including a key UK-US military base, to the Indian Ocean nation.
title: UK Weighs Front-Loading Payments for Mauritius in Chagos Deal

description: The UK’s opposition Conservative Party sought a vote in parliament on Wednesday calling for a national inquiry into so-called child grooming gangs, in an effort to pose a political problem for Keir Starmer’s Labour government while winning the attention of billionaire Elon Musk.
title: UK Tories Vie For Musk’s Attention With Grooming Probe Vote

description: The Chinese government pledged to deepen its anti-corruption drive across a broad sweep of industries, including finance and energy — a sign that President Xi Jinping’s campaign against dirty officials will roll on for the foreseeable future.
title: China Vows to Deepen Graft Fight in Areas Like Finance, Energy

description: The BRICS group of emerging-market powers — the acronym stands for Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa — has gone from a slogan dreamed up at an investment bank two decades ago to a real-world club that controls a multilateral lender. Comprising 10 member states, it pairs several major energy producers with some of the biggest consumers among developing countries. The group has been increasing its ranks, enhancing its economic clout in a US-dominated world.
title: What to Know About BRICS and Its Growing Clout

description: President-elect Donald Trump is once again talking about the US buying Greenland, the world’s biggest island and a self-ruling territory of Denmark.
title: Can Trump Buy Greenland? What to Know Besides ‘No’

description: The idea of opening up public lands to development enjoys bipartisan support and cuts through red tape.
title: The US Government Is Sitting on a Possible Solution to the Housing Crisis

description: Donald Trump’s threat of tariffs on Denmark over its control of Greenland and musings about “economic force” to absorb Canada as a US state were a fresh reminder of how rocky executing the president-elect’s trade agenda could prove.
title: Trump Trade Team Set for Wild Ride as Boss Floats Denmark Levies

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump’s Revived Greenland Gambit Sees Life Imitate Art

description: Italian reporter Cecilia Sala was released from an Iranian prison and is on a plane leaving the country, the Italian government said in a statement on Wednesday.
title: Italian Journalist Cecilia Sala Is Freed From Iranian Prison

description: President Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine triggered an economic boom in Russia built on the back of government stimulus. Almost three years on, there are gathering signs the bill is about to come due.
title: Putin’s Booming War Economy Poised for Soft, Bumpy Landing

description: Ireland’s National Asset Management Agency set out a plan to complete its wind down by the end of 2025 on Thursday.
title: Ireland’s Crisis-Era Bad Bank Sets Out Plan to Wind Down in 2025

description: Britain’s health problems began during the austerity era and left its economy more vulnerable to the Covid pandemic, a study found.
title: Britain’s Sickness Crisis Began During Austerity, Report Says

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s nominees will begin testifying before the US Senate next week as Republicans rush to install the new cabinet soon after the Jan. 20 inauguration.
title: Trump’s Cabinet Picks Prepare for Senate Confirmation Hearings

description: Finnish authorities deemed the detained tanker that’s part of the fleet carrying Russian oil as not seaworthy after inspections onboard.
title: Finland Says Detained Shadow-Fleet Tanker Is Not Seaworthy

description: French consumer confidence unexpectedly fell in December to the lowest level in a year, adding to signals the country’s prolonged political and budget crisis is weighing on the economic outlook.
title: French Consumer Sentiment Unexpectedly Falls Amid Political Gloom

description: Germany’s independent antidiscrimination commissioner has urged the government to shut down its X accounts, saying the Elon Musk-owned social media platform has become “an instrument of political influence for the world’s richest man.”
title: German Government Urged to Quit X by Antidiscrimination Adviser

description: India’s government plans to simplify its income tax filing rules to make it less tedious for taxpayers to comply with the law and help cut down on disputes that have ballooned to more than $120 billion over the past decade.
title: India to Simplify Decades-Old Income Tax Filing Rules in Budget

description: The European Union must be ready to defend itself from possible punitive trade measures from the new US administration, as President-elect Donald Trump returns to the White House later this month. That’s what the new Commission’s Vice-President Stéphane Séjourné, who’s in charge of the bloc’s industrial strategy, told Bloomberg’s Oliver Crook in an exclusive interview in Brussels. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: EU Can’t Risk Complacency Ahead of Trump, Sejourne Says

description: The European Union must be ready to defend itself against protectionist trade measures by other countries, including any new steps taken by Donald Trump when he returns to the White House later this month, the bloc’s industry chief said.
title: EU Can’t Risk Complacency Ahead of Trump, Industry Chief Says

description: The world’s richest person has his sights set on Germany, the UK — and the EU’s regulatory powers.
title: Musk Takes Slash-and-Burn Style to Europe After Bolstering Trump

description: The German conservative in pole position to become the next chancellor is toughening his position on migration as he tries to fend off the threat of the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD).
title: German Conservatives Embrace Hard Line on Migrants to Combat AfD

description: South Korea’s impeached leader is barricaded in his Seoul residence, protected by a blockade of buses, barbed wire, crowds of supporters and his own armed security guards. The question now is whether investigators can arrest him without a violent confrontation.
title: South Korean Standoff Over Yoon’s Arrest Risks Violent Turn

description: Malaysia unveiled a slew of tax incentives to lure investors to its joint special economic zone with Singapore that seeks to add $26 billion per year to the Malaysian economy by 2030.
title: Malaysia Unveils Tax Breaks for New Economic Zone With Singapore

description: President Joe Biden’s administration plans to streamline permitting for geothermal energy development as part of a broader executive order to boost infrastructure for AI data centers, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Biden to Push Geothermal Energy to Boost AI Growth
